These cravings can range from material belongings, to more appropriate or elaborated feelings that are instilled through the emotional or relational association with inanimate objects that bring us great joy, such as the one presented in this article.</p> <p>Physically speaking pools are essential for an individual that seeks to increase the depth of the product, service and its utility and thus finds pools to be the perfect source of relaxation and rejuvenation as the weightlessness of ourselves while in water is a truly unique (and perhaps addicting) experience.</p> <p>So today we have compiled a list of 14 of the most amazing pools around the world that feature natural springs, theme parks and even spa based pools that put your local community swimming pool to shame, and more! So read on and enjoy the pools that you must surely wish to have in your deck (provided you could even fit them in there!).</p> <h2>10. Glenwood Hot springs Lodge</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-558.jpeg"/>Colorado hot springs resorts <p>Based in Glenwood springs, Colorado in the United States, this pool is basically based on a hot spring that gushes water naturally and is resultantly a very popular tourist destination. It has been operational since 1888 and thus is deeply embedded in the regional heritage of the area. While it is naturally a hot spring, it is perhaps an inclusion into this list of a unique capacity but it surely has a hot spring that will send you in awe.</p> <p>Locals believe that the water here is a great and effective alternative to medication in many cases and that the water rejuvenates the skin, revitalize your health and refreshes the mind. And at 90 degrees, with over 15 minerals embedded inside, this natural hot spring has 3.5 million gallons of water that refill daily. Due to the popularity, it has been termed as the Spa of the Rockies since the 1900s and is famed as the largest hot spring in the world. A must visit for anyone up for relaxation. It has 2 cold water pools</p> <h2>9. Grace Santorin</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-559.jpeg"/>Shutterstock <p>In the picturesque Grecian island of Santorin, one can find the jaw droopingly stunning holiday destination of the Grace Santorin that offers an infinity pool display outside to give the full experience of witnessing the beautiful landscape and clear skies on offer at the island. While it only features 20 rooms.</p> <p>Grace Santorin, is very expensive in terms of cost and rightfully so, considering it has amenities like a world renowned mixologist who can fix you a pristine drink for that tantalizing dip in the infinity pool. The pool definitely sums up the Mediterranean experience.</p> <h2>8. Nemo 33</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-560.jpeg"/>Wikipedia <p>Based out of Brussels in Belgium, the Nemo 33 (not based on the popular fish of the same name) is the deepest indoor pool in the world and is perfect for those that are addicted to diving or wish to practice it in a safe environment. Featuring built in caves and on spot diving classes for those that are new and still dare to take it up. With a depth of 113 feet, this pool has an astounding 660,000 gallons of water that is artificially warmed to help visitors dive for longer without the need to resurface to regain heat. The pool only opened in 2004 and caters to children as young as 12.</p> <h2>7. Golden Nugget</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-561.jpeg"/>global.14 <p>Operating out of Las Vegas, this iconic pools are a must visit for those that live off of adrenaline and require that kick of always being on the edge. Famous for its proximity to the fish and shark tank, the Golden Nugget especially features a shark chute for those that are looking for an extra bit of adrenaline and want to get up closer to the sharks. For those that do not find thrill to be their forte, there is the option to sit next to the pools and witness the fish swim from a distance.</p>     <h2>6. Antique pool</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-562.jpeg"/>flickr <p>This beautiful pool located in Palma Kali in Turkey is truly one of a kind when it comes to pools. What’s unique about it is that it is situated on an ancient Roman ruins site which used to be the famous city of Hierapolis. Swimmers of this pool can look at the remains below themselves as they float over a former architectural masterpiece. The pool formed due to natural hot springs that allow the swimmers to also bathe in mineral enriched spring water. Surrounded by the shade of trees, this picturesque pool envelops the columns of the temple of Apollo as well due to the fact that its depth varies a lot. While the admission may not be the cheapest, the scenic swim is a must visit for history geeks.</p> <h2>5. Gold energy pool</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-563.jpeg"/>tripadvisor <p>Out of the St Regis lesser resort in Tibet comes this unique pool that looks like it is made out of melted gold (or urine according to some skeptics). Fact of the matter is that this pool has tiles made of all gold and these reflect to give the pool its golden hue. This pool is the visitors best shot at giving themselves a Richie Rich moment with some extra spirituality involved.</p> <h2>4. Santa Alfonso del Mar sweet water pool</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-564.jpeg"/>wearesweet.co <p>Located in Algarroba, Chile this is the second largest pool in the world, only lost the title to the City Stars Pool in Egypt to the same owners. It sprawls over an incredible 20 acres of land and holds 66 million gallons of treated salt water straight out of the adjoining Pacific Ocean. What’s even more incredible is that it cost an elephantine 2 billion to make, with a further 4 million on upkeep annually. Not exactly your average backyard pool, eh?</p> <p> </p> <h2>3. Library pool</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-565.jpeg"/>Tripadvisor <p>The library resort pool in Thailand is unique as it holds a different shade of red which looks akin to blood or at the very least dyed water. In fact, it was an optical illusion after the resort hired a professional to give this inspiring touch to its pool.</p> <h2>2. Giola lagoon</h2> <img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-566.jpeg"/>My Greece Travel Blog <p>This natural pool is situated on the scenic ocean surrounded Greek Island of Patios that is hard to get to because of topographical access but holds immense value due to its positioning right next to the ocean. Swimmers in this natural pool get a pristine view of the Aegean Sea, all the while enjoying the relatively warmer-than-ocean pool. This pool is still novelty for tourists as it is relatively remote due to a lack of ease of access and thus is still a virgin site for any adventurous tourist.</p> <h2>1. Blue Lagoon geothermal spa</h2> <p><img src="https://cdnone.netlify.com/db/2017/12/word-image-567.jpeg"/> shutterstock</p>     <p>Based in Iceland, this pool was a natural byproduct of the nearby built power plant and ever since its creation in the 1970s; it has become a central location for health seeking pool dippers. It was built back when bathing had begun to be common in Iceland and people soon realized that the pool had immense benefits for skin as the enriching minerals in the water combined with the revitalizing soil nutrients on the pool floor to give off amazing benefits to the body, especially the skin. Experts claimed it to be a miracle cure for the skin condition Psoriasis and it became to be known for its status as a spa destination quite instantly. The owners campaign for a healthier lifestyle and promote cleaner energy to endorse the pool as an iconic destination.</p>   <i></i>
